II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?

III. METHODOLOGY
07/05/2022 Special Investigation Intake 2022C0214027
07/05/2022 Special Investigation Initiated - On Site
07/05/2022 Contact - Face to Face interviews with Youth A, Administrator, and
Therapist.
07/05/2022 Contact - Document Received: email from Staff 2 to Therapist.
07/06/2022 Contact - Document Received: Staff information, policy, and team
meeting minutes.
07/08/2022 Contact - Telephone call made for interview with Youth B.

for Youth B.
07/11/2022 Contact - Telephone call made for interview with Staff 2.

07/19/2022 Pre-exit interview with Administrator.
ALLEGATION:
Within the last month, 18-year-old youth at facility had another youth pose and took
a picture of youth in their boxer shorts. This was taken to send to someone else as
a nude photo. Youth was also asked for a picture to be taken of their genitals. It is
unknown where staff were when this occurred.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/5/22. Youth A reported
Youth B asked to take a picture of Youth A's butt with Youth A's boxer shorts on and
Youth A allowed this to occur. Youth A feared if not granting the request, Youth B
would no longer be friends. Youth B informed Youth A the photo was needed for "a
guy on snapchat". Youth B then asked for a picture of Youth A's "downstairs area" to
which Youth A declined. Youth B threatened their friendship, but Youth A continued
to refuse. Youth A also reported this occurred on a Friday during the day when both
Youth were in their shared bedroom and staff were in the milieu. Staff had just
finished a room check when this took place. Youth A reported staff always do their
15-minute room checks on the youth. Youth A feels safe at the facility now that
Youth B has left. This is the reason Youth A is now reporting the incident to staff.
2

Administrator and Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/5/22. The Therapist indicated not knowing about the allegations until observing the
report yesterday. Both reported staff have been doing daily searches and more
intense searches once a week. They believe this incident may have occurred
sometime between the first allegations involving Youth B and the second allegations
involving Youth B. Staff have been following the safety plans in place involving
Youth B. Therapist reported receiving an email about the allegations from Staff 2 on
Sunday after Youth A told Staff 2. Administrator also reported Youth B possessed a
cell phone from 5/16 to 5/21, at which time Youth B turned the phone over to staff.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on 7/8/22. Youth B strongly denied the
allegations and provided no further information.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/11/22. She reported being told about
the allegations by Youth A approximately a week ago. She believed the incident took
place when Youth B had a cell phone a couple of months prior to her being
informed. She was told by Youth A that Youth B asked to take a picture of Youth A's
butt to put on "snapchat" to share with someone. Youth A agreed but refused to
allow a picture of Youth A's "downstairs area” (genital area) when Youth B asked for
another picture. Youth A felt uncomfortable about the request and did not feel
comfortable enough to say anything until Youth B was discharged from the program.
Staff 2 also reported she sent the email to get clarification from her supervisor before
reporting the incident. She understands the actions a "mandated reporter" must take
but was unsure what action she should take once finding out after Youth B had left
the program. She was planning on making a report as soon as she received
direction from her supervisor. She does not believe Youth B was on a "one-on-one”
supervision at that time but did begin that level of supervision shortly after.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/12/22. She reported on 7/4/22 Youth A
shared the allegations with her. She provided the same information as Staff 2 and
Youth A presented during their interviews. Youth A told her she felt pressured by
Youth B and only comfortable enough to share once Youth B was removed from the
facility. Staff 1 was unclear when it may have occurred but believed it occurred when
Youth B had a cell phone a few months ago. She also reported staff found out about
the cell phone but are not allowed to take the cell phone and had to wait until the
youth was willing to give it over to them. Youth B was placed on "one-on-one"
supervision shortly after this occurred a few months ago.
Documents Reviewed:
Email from Staff 2 to Therapist dated 7/3/22. Staff 2 informs Therapist that Youth
A reported during the time Youth A and Youth B had cell phones, Youth B took a
picture of Youth A's butt to send to someone on snapchat. Youth A reported to Staff
2, refusing to allow other pictures to be taken and refusing to "mess" around with
Youth B. Staff 2 also reported to Therapist, Youth B had written letters to other youth
3

who still had the letters. Staff 2 was requesting information on reporting an incident
after the fact.
Maple Team Meeting Minutes dated 6/20/22. This document outlines the agenda
that occurred at this team meeting and who was in attendance. Under the policies
section of this report contraband is documented as Tier 1 - Daily on 1st and 2nd
shifts a visual scan of the youth's room is to occur and any visible contraband is to
be removed. Tier 2 - Weekly a more thorough search through youth's belongings is
to occur. This is to be unannounced, so the youth are not given time to hide/store
their contraband elsewhere prior to the search. A reminder of the mandated
reporting requirements is outline on this report. All staff are identified as mandated
reporters and must report to CPS if allegations of abuse/neglect are reported to
them by youth or they become aware of abuse/neglect. They are also to notify
Therapist or on-call clinician when making a report just to give them a heads up.
Supervision was documented as being addressed and if two youth are outside or in
any room together staff are to also "be there". The information sharing section
identified Youth B as requiring 1:1 staff until discharge. It is documented that Youth
B has been spending a lot of time in the bedroom sleeping".
Mandated Reporting of Abuse & Neglect dated 12/21. This report documents the
facility will follow the Child protection Law of Michigan. It is stated, "Should a staff
member become aware of abuse or neglect, they will notify the On-call Clinician
immediately and immediately contact Centralized Intake themselves". Also stated,
"Any suspected or known abuse or neglect will be reported verbally by the person
who first became aware of or witnessed the abuse/neglect to Child Protective
Services by the end of the notifying staff’s shift by calling Centralized Intake".
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
4

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance with the sufficiency of staff.
Staff responded to the information as required and the level of
supervision at the time was appropriate. Later investigation
would result in an increase in the level of supervision for Youth
B.
Consultation
If youth are found to have a cell phone, rather than waiting for
the youth to turn in the phone, it is recommended that the level
of supervision increases, not allowing the youth to freely use the
phone.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend no change to the license status of this child caring institution.
